page.title: 12Davenham Parish Council
page.content: The Parish Council are a group of men and women between the ages of 21 and 80 concerned with local government. There are 11 people who are elected to be on the Parish Council. Their job is to look after the community. The plans they have at the moment are the by-pass to be built in 1989, another tree planting scheme, more plants in the war memorial, to make sure the village is kept clean and tidy and provide a new toddlers playground. They get the money for these things by putting 1.4p on rates. We asked them what things they would like to see for the village. They said less traffic and more community spirit. They weren't trained to be a Parish Councillor and out of the 11 people on the PC three of them are women.
